isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION, TANDEM DRIVE AXLES: EATON - INSTALL

important.para: Before installing carrier assembly, inspect and thoroughly clean interior of axle housing using an appropriate solvent and clean rag.

note.para: Use silicone rubber gasket compound on axle housing mating surface as shown in Figure 14. Completely remove all old gasket material prior to applying new material. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the recommended gasket compound. Install carrier and axle housing cover before compound sets or reapply.

step1.para: Install differential carrier assembly. If rear cover and shaft assembly have been removed, install differential carrier first.

note.para: To assist in installing complete differential carrier, use two pieces of threaded rod threaded into carrier bolt holes. Rod should be approximately 6 inches long. Use these to pilot the carrier into the housing.

step1.para: Install carrier to axle housing lockwashers, bolts and nuts. Tighten to 160 to 176 ft-lbs. (217 to 239 N•m).

If removed, install rear housing cover/output shaft assembly. Tighten all bolts to proper specifications. Install inter-axle driveline making sure yokes are in phase. (If assembly has not been removed, skip to step 4.)
Install axle shafts and axle stud nuts. (If used, also install lockwashers and tapered dowels.)
Add axle lubricant. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for recommended lubricants. Fill to bottom of filler hole; add two pints to power divider unit.
Connect main driveline, making sure all yokes are in phase. Lubricate U-joints.
Connect differential lockout air line, if so equipped.
